Add your income and expense categories, tapping on them to add amounts. If you need to add more categories, tap the '+' add button infront of the 'Income' or 'Expense' category. content.display-value: Once you hit done, you'll be taken to the budget's overview screen.
Take a look at this youtube video for guidance.
The fastest and easier way to create your next budget is by cloning your current budget to create you next budget.
While cloning budget, you can choose to rollover remaining from categories to your next budget. That will be usefull in the case you would likeyour budget to track cumulative saving over the time.
This are step for cloning a budget

display-value: From the dashboard press on the 'I want to...' button located in the bottom menu at the far right
In the action-sheet, Press on 'Clone to create next budget'
Select a begin and end date
(Optional) The checkbox 'Include income' will include you next the next budget
(Optional) The checkbox 'Include expenses transactions' will copy all the expenses transaction from you current budget to the next budget
(Optional) The checkbox 'Rollover remaining for categories' will add the remaining from previous month budgeted categies to you next month budgeted category
(Optional) The checkbox  'Rollover Saving/deficit' will take you saving from previous category and create an income entry in your next budget
By default all your categories are include, you can select and edit categories by Pressing the blue link link with s pencil at the bottom
Press on 'SAVE' at the top-right to create you budget

subsections.subtitle: I'm not able to add next month transaction in my budget

content.display-value: If you have transferred $10 from another category, that cannot be taken into consideration for the clone.The clone feature only take into consolidation the amount used to create your category or the updated value, which is the normal behavior.We can have multiples scenarios depending on the user case and it is not possible to handle all of them.This became really complicate and we had found this common point to implement for the majority of our users.
It became complicated when you start updating the values of the budgeted amount since we keep only one level memory.
Considere this senario:

display-value: If you create a budgeted category with $200 for January and have a remaining of $10
Rolling over for February will be $210 for total budgeted. If remain $40, then rolling over for March will have $240 for total budgeted
Let said in February you had updated the budgeted amount from $210 to $250 with a remaining of $40
Rolling over to March will have $290 because the memory has be temper with you update.
If you have made a transfer from another category, it will not affect the memory
